text.text: This mall boasts one of the most unconventional mixes of shops. Once a haven for Japanese and Korean eats, it is now a bit of an everything mall, with a few famous spots still holding strong. Perfect for escaping the scorching midday sun, thanks to its gloriously chilly air con.

text.text: Central Mall at Clarke Quay is a convenient and modern shopping destination located in the heart of Singapore‚Äôs vibrant riverside district. While not as large as some of the city‚Äôs mega-malls, it offers a good mix of retail outlets, dining options, and essential services, making it a practical stop for both office workers and tourists. Its proximity to Clarke Quay‚Äôs nightlife, restaurants, and scenic river views adds to its appeal. However, the mall itself can feel a bit dated compared to newer developments, and the shopping selection is more functional than luxurious. Ideal for a quick visit, but not a must-see for hardcore shoppers.

text.text: Very happening place in Singapore. There are a lot of pubs and restaurants. Can get every type of food. Also there is big swing, if you want to have thrilling experience must try that. Veg, non veg, vegan all types of restaurants nearby. In weekend come here and sit near the lake enjoy the vibe.

text.text: I was strolling through this area on my last day in Singapore, I came across so many eye catching stores and the best was Don Don Donki where I got all the Kit Kat flavours I could find üòçüòçüòç, will definitely be visiting this central again if I‚Äôm in Singapore and probably explore it more

text.text: Relatively small mall. Limited choices of restaurants and shops to explore. Have office spaces.
